location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Oriented toward the foremost frontier in science and technology and the critical needs of China’s development,the school has undertaken many national scientific and technological research projects, such as the National Program on Key Basic Research Project (973 Program), theNational High-Tech R&D Programof China (863Program),

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	School of Geographic and Oceanographic Sciences
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	School of Geographic and Oceanographic Sciences
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The School of Geographic and Oceanographic Sciences (SGOS) is now comprised of 118 faculty and staff members and 980 undergraduates and postgraduates, and offers one National Key Discipline in physical geography and three Provincial Key Disciplines in cartography and GIS, land use and planning (human geography), and marine Geography.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	SGOS has taken a distinct role in academic circles while receiving recognition and praise in such fields as Earth surface processes and environmental changes, carbon cycle and land-atmosphere remote sensing, coastal zone environment and resources, regional sustainable development and land use, as well as tourism geography.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Over the past three years, SGOS has presided over 10 projects, including projects and research tasks under the 973 Program and the 863 Program, major programs supported by the National Social Science Foundation and the National Natural Science Foundation of China, as well as special research projects for
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	public industrial
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	sectors. SGOS has published more than 100 academic papers in journals collected by the Scientific Citation Index (SCI). SGOS has newly established three innovative research teams respectively honored by the National Natural Science Foundation, the Ministry of Education and the Jiangsu provincial government.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	SGOS faculty members have won many awards and honors over the past three years, including the second prize of the National Natural Science Award (2010), second prize of the National Science and Technology Progress Award (2009), first prize of the Ministry of Land and Resources S&T Award (2012), first prize of the National Mapping Technology Progress Award (2009), and the honorary membership of the French Geographical Society and INQUA (2010).
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	SGOS is a major national training base for scientific researchers and teachers in geography with its internship centers in Lushan Mountain, Lianyungang, and Ningzhen areas. It offers undergraduate, postgraduate and graduate programs, including post-doctoral stations, and has established innovative training programs such as the “Lake Baikal in Russia Comprehensive Scientific Investigation” and the “Taiwan Earth Science Comprehensive Joint Teaching Visits.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	In recent years, SGOS faculty and students have received many accolades and awards, such as the Award for Distinguished University Teachers and the National Award for Excellent Teaching, the state-level best university course title for two courses, two honors for provincial-level outstanding doctoral dissertations and five honors for provincial-level outstanding master’s theses, as well as the Academic Award for New and Outstanding Doctoral Candidates by the Ministry of Education.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	SGOS faculty comprises a number of prestigious scientists and scholars, including Li Jijun and Wang Ying, both Academicians of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and Chen Yuchuan, Academician of the Chinese Academy of Engineering, as well as winners of the National Science Foundation for Distinguished Young Scholars, including Gao Shu, Gu Chaoli, Zhou Chenghu, Gong Peng, Shi Zhong, Lu Huayu, and Li Xin.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	SGOS has also built a series of scientific research and teaching platforms, such as the Ministry of Education Key Laboratory for Coast and Island Development, Jiangsu Branch of the National Remote Sensing Center, National Demonstration Center for Experiment and Teaching in Earth Sciences,
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	and Demonstration Center for Experiment and Teaching in Geographic and Oceanographic Sciences for the universities in Jiangsu Province
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	To meet the challenge of resource development and environmental protection in China, the SGOS faculty and students have participated in the planning aid programs for Tibet's development and the master planning of land use in Jiangsu Province. They have presided over the development of Rules of Drawing for Master Planning of Land Use in the City, County and Township, which has produced significant social benefits after being implemented nationwide.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	They have undertaken a series of major engineering tasks and special projects in the national high-resolution earth observation system and coast and island development, including the launch of Digital South China Sea and remote sensing and monitoring of the resources and environment in the South China Sea and its surrounding areas, and the research of China’s forest carbon sink which has provided the government with the scientific tools and knowledge to make decisions on climate change negotiations and carbon emission trading.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The faculty and students have also been actively involved in the study of African geography by hosting a number of seminars on “Going to Africa for Development” and publishing books including the Records and Maps of Agriculture in Africa. In addition, SGOS has made significant contributions to regional planning, tourism resources planning and other areas. Its professors serve as deputy editors or editorial members of dozens of SCI journals and major academic publications in China, and over 20 professors serve as vice chairs or directors of state-level academic societies.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	School of Atmospheric Sciences
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The School of Atmospheric Sciences at Nanjing University
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The School of Atmospheric Sciences at NJU is the cradle of modern meteorological education and research in China. It has been one of China’s most respected degree programs in atmospheric sciences.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The opening ceremony of the
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	School of Atmospheric Sciences (top), and the group photo (bottom).
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The history of this discipline at NJU can be traced back to 1905, when the physics curriculum first included meteorological courses atLiang-Jiang Normal School, one of the predecessors of the university. In the 1920s, Dr. Kochen Chu founded the Department of Geoscience at the National Southeast University (which later on became National Central University). In 1924, the department established three research disciplines in geology, meteorology, and geography. This was the earliest meteorology major in China and was the basis of the country’s first department of meteorology, established at the National Central University in 1944.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	In 1952, the National Central University meteorology program became part of the reorganized Nanjing University. In 1986, the department of meteorology was renamed the Department of Atmospheric Sciences when the first Atmospheric Environment major in the nation was established. In 2008, the Department of Atmospheric Sciences was promoted to the level of college within the university and gained its current name of School of Atmospheric Sciences (SAS).
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	The meteorology/atmospheric science program at Nanjing University began to enroll doctoral students in 1986 and established its post-doctoral research station in 1996. In 1998, the doctoral program of Nanjing University Atmospheric Sciences gained the First-Grade Doctoral Program designation within China. In 2000, the Key Laboratory of Mesoscale Severe Weather/Ministry of Education of China (MOE) was established, and in 2008, SAS came into being.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Over the years, the department and school have undertaken a large number of national-level research projects, made significant contributions in basic and applied research in atmospheric sciences, and made key scientific and technological achievements in the field for national economic and social development and for national defense. Meanwhile, the program has trained more than 6,000 meteorological professionals, producing many professors, researchers, and outstanding operational weather forecasters. Among them are 11 academicians of Chinese Academy of Sciences and Chinese Academy of Engineering. The atmospheric science program at NJU has been a key supplier of advanced-level research and operational meteorologists to the country.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Overview of the school buildings
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Over the past 90 years, the atmospheric science program at NJU’s SAS has established itself as a leading school for atmospheric science education and research, where students and researchers are inspired to seek advanced knowledge and scientific advancement and innovation and make their marks in the world. SAShas the Ministry of Education designations of the doctorate program and post-doctoral research station in atmospheric sciences, and doctoral and master’s programs in sub-disciplines of meteorology, atmospheric physics and atmospheric environment, climate systems and climate change. Each year, it recruits about 100 undergraduate, 40 master and 20 doctoral students. It emphasizes both “general” and “personalized” approaches to education, with special programs tailored to fulfill these goals. It has established multiple research and education platforms, including 12 Production-Teaching-Research-Application platforms in collaboration with the national meteorological and environmental protection agencies, the undergraduate “Innovation Program” and “Special Talent Program,” and “Center for Teaching Excellence Demonstration.” These platforms greatly facilitate the development of both research and application oriented talents among the students.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	At present, SAS consists of 94 faculty members, including 24 full professors, 24 associate professors, 6 lecturers, and 21 researchers, and 50 of them have had overseas education experience. The faculty includes
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	3 Academicians of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (including 1 international faculty member)
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	1 member of the Finnish Academy of Science and Letter
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	1 winner of the "Changjiang Distinguished Professor" title by the Ministry of Education
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	1 on the national “Thousand-Person Plan” special talent recruitment program
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	2 recipients of the national “Distinguished Young Scientist Research Funds”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	2 on the national “Junior Thousand-Person Plan” recruitment plan
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	3 titled “Principal Scientists of the National Foundational Research 973 Program"
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	2 recipients of the national “New Century Tens of Thousands Talents Program”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	2 recipients of the national “Outstanding Young Scientist Research Funds”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	4 recipients of the Ministry-of-Education’s “Millennial Talent Program.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	In addition, the faculty members have also won many provincial and ministerial level special titles, awards and designations. Last but not least, one of the SAS’s Ph.D. dissertations won the prestigious national Outstanding Doctoral Dissertation Award.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Pictures of the four research institutions
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	SAS’s research activities are organized through several research laboratories. They include
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Key Laboratory of Mesoscale Severe Weather/MOE
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	China Meteorological Administration-Nanjing University Joint Laboratory for Climate Prediction Research
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Nanjing University - University of Helsinki Joint International Laboratory of Atmospheric and Earth System Sciences
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	China Meteorological Administration-Nanjing University Joint Center for Atmospheric Radar Research.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	In the meantime, SAS has founded the first cross-disciplinary Institute for Climate and Global Change Research (ICGCR) with other schools of geosciences at Nanjing University. Based on ICGCR, SAS has established the “Jiangsu Climate Change Collaborative Innovation Center for Climate Change” with funding from the Jiangsu Province.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	For teaching, SAS has a “Center for Teaching Excellence,” which contains a library and seven subsidiary education facilities, including those for “Weather Forecasting Training and Practice,” “Lab for Meteorological Measurements,” “Lab for Atmospheric Boundary Layer Observations,” “Lab for Atmospheric Chemistry,” “Lab for Atmospheric Remote Sensing,” “Lab for Numerical Simulations,” and the “High-Performance Computing and Data Center.” In total, SAS owns a high-performance computing platform consisting of more than 5000 CPU cores capable of 90 teraflops per second.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	Academic visits by SAA faculty at (left) the University of Oklahoma, and (right) University of Helsinki
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	During the period of the 12th national “Five-Year Plan,” rapid progress was made with the support of the national “211 Project,” “985 Project,” and “Advantage Discipline Development Program of Jiangsu Province.” Guided by the principle of “increasing the depth, broadening the scope, and maintaining uniqueness,” SAS applied the concept of “Enhancing strengths, developing applications, and promoting interdisciplinary collaborations” to the disciplinary development. It further enhanced its traditional research strength in the three areas of “Mesoscale Severe Weather,” “East Asian Monsoon and Climate Change,” and “Atmospheric Environment and Chemistry.” It established and strengthened research in “Radar Meteorology,” “Urban Meteorology” and “Meteorological Resource Applications” in response to the national needs and developed new interdisciplinary research in “Interactions of Air Pollution and Climate Change,” “Human Activities and Climate Change,” and “Socioeconomic Impacts of Climate and Global Changes.” As a result, the overall research scope and capabilities are significantly improved.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	In recent years, SAS has significantly improved its observational and field experiment abilities for weather and earth systems. For example, it has established the “Station for Observing Regional Processes of the Earth System (SORPES)” and the “Mesoscale Mobile Weather Observatory” (TMNET), which includes a mobile C-band polarimetric weather radar and a fixed X-band polarimetric radar.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/yxjj/list.htm	In the area of international collaborations, SAS has hosted the integrated Land Ecosystem-Atmosphere Processes Study (iLEAPS) international office (IPO), and has hosted and/or participated in several international scientific projects, such as “Understanding and Prediction of Rainfall Associated with Landfalling Tropical Cyclones” (UPDRAFT) project and the Pan-Eurasia Experiment (PEEX). Many innovative research results with significant international impact have been obtained, including those on the physical mechanisms and forecasting of severe weather such as several thunderstorms and tropical cyclones, the predictability and mechanisms of atmospheric general circulation and climate change in east Asia, and the distribution, transportation, and weather and climate effects of air pollutants. In recent years, more than 250 papers were published in SCI journals, and the faculty members have won provincial- and ministerial-level research awards six times, including two first prizes.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/3d/c4897a164413/page.htm	Supply Chain Management is defined as the design, operation, estimation and improvement of the systems that create and deliver the firm’s primary products and service. Our objective in this course is to introduce relevant concepts, techniques and methods. In particular, some of the topics covered include: operations strategy, supply chain coordination, inventory management, business process reengineering, mass customization, and waiting line management etc. The course relies on a combination of case discussions, lectures, readings, and assignments. To pursue the course objective most effectively, students will have to prepare the assigned cases, readings, and discuss them in class.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/39/c4897a164409/page.htm	Ever since Max Weber’s analysis, Chinese cities before modern times have long been categorized as the typical “oriental-type-of-city”, or the administrative-centers. Compared with the Western European cities, which are characterized with the autonomy in social, political and economic life, as well the strong sense of citizenship, the Chinese cities seem to play a much less dynamic role in history. However, urban studies in the past decades increasingly remind us that the historical role of Chinese cities should not be overlooked just because of their differences from the Western counterparts. Instead, the study of Chinese cities would provide new perspectives to explore the development of Chinese society.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/39/c4897a164409/page.htm	Week 1 Defining “City” in China

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/38/c4897a164408/page.htm	“Internal control is a process, effected by an entity’s board of directors, management, and other personnel, designed to provide reasonable assurance regarding the achievement of objectives relating to operations, reporting, and compliance.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/38/c4897a164408/page.htm	“Control comprises those elements of an organization (including its resources, systems, processes, culture, structure and tasks) that, taken together, support people in the achievement of the organization’s objectives”.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/38/c4897a164408/page.htm	During the term you will extensively analyze and discuss cases involving real organizations. You will put yourself in the role of the manager in various settings, critically consider the situation and respond verbally and on paper. Case-based, experiential learning emphasizes and develops important discovery skills – curiosity, problem identification, information search, evidence evaluation and, finally, effectively communicating an understanding. Professional accountants must develop these skills to enable a lifelong process of learning, growth and value creation.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/38/c4897a164408/page.htm	Much of your prior experiences in high school and college courses likely focused on knowledge gained via repetition and completion of practice questions (e.g. the sort typically found at the end of textbook chapters). If so, cases that appear ambiguous may leave you feeling frustrated. While it is true that there is generally no unique, correct answer to a case, there is always a rigorous analysis to be conducted. To fully investigate a case, you must actively understand your intentions, hypotheses and assumptions – you have to understand the why of your conclusions.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/38/c4897a164408/page.htm	Class meetings will generally have three elements. First, some introduction by me – could be administrative information, announcements or other stage setting. Second, discussion of the case, led by the assigned team or by me if no team is assigned that day. Finally, we will settle on the key elements of the case that you should be sure you understand and then segue into the next bit of material, teeing up the next case.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/36/c4897a164406/page.htm	This course is purporting to lecture on evolution of China’s foreign policy since end of Cold War with focus on its goal, interest calculus, and essential means. As an introductory seminar, the course will provide students with analytical framework to examine how a rising power address its foreign interests and carry out on its external relations. The course will offer a concise but explicit interpretation of China’s foreign policy making process and domestic structure which affect its policy outcomes. The course will also pick up a number of essential bilateral ties, for instance, China-US relations, China-Japan relations and China-ASEAN relations, to demonstrate leading characters of its foreign policy.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/82/30/c4897a164400/page.htm	This course is designed to prepare current students with an understanding of the nature of administrative law in china. The course begins with the history of china’s administrative law. Topics covered in the course will closely connect with the basic concepts and the new development in china’s administrative law. Students need study administrative acts including administrative license, administrative penalty, administrative compulsion and other informal acts. Administrative Process Law and Administrative Litigation Law all studied in this course.

location4:not found index:http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/academy_members	Long engaged in research on superconductive electronics, Prof. Wu enjoys international reputation as a universally acknowledged team leader in the field. location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/rightwnfo_7067/list.htm	On this year's May Fourth Youth Day, a “post-1980s” professor was awarded the “May Fourth Youth Medal." He is Wang Xinran, a professor and doctoral adviser at the School of Electronic Science and Engineering of Nanjing University. He has developed the world's first high Ion/Ioffratio graphene nanoribbon field-effect transistor and has kept a world record of the Ion/Ioffratio. In 2011, he gave up the good working and living conditions abroad and came back to China his motherland. He was selected as one of those in the first batch of “Global Young Experts Program” Scholars.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/sports_competitions/list.htm	Nanjing University currently has four high-level sports teams for men’s and women’s athletics, women’s volleyball, women’s basketball and men’s football, and 16 ordinary student teams for men’s and women’s basketball, men’s volleyball, women’s football, table-tennis, badminton and tennis. location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwweywwaboratory/list.htm	As one of the major research centers in the field of condensed matter physics in China, NLSSM carried out researches projects on various sub-fields: artificial microstructure physics, quantum physics and the associated electronics, nanostructure properties and devices, soft condensed matter physics and computational physics. These research efforts are funded by several national, provincial and ministerial research funds, including 6 projects by the National Basic Research Program of China (973 Program), 15 sub-projects of the 973 Program, 4 projects of the National High-Tech R&D Program of China, 7 projects of the Key Program of National Natural Science Fund of China and so on. Since 2002, NLSSM’s faculty members have won the first prize of the NationalNatural Science once and the second prize of the NationalNatural Science 6 times.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwweywwaboratory/list.htm	The laboratory mainly focuses onthe researchof novel software technologies and the correspondingapplications. It aims to leverage the challenges and opportunities in the rapid development of novel software technologies, and meets the requirements in the aspect of information construction of the country. Moreover, the laboratory explores important scientific problems in the area of computer software, studies basic and common problems in novel software technologies, and adheres to the guiding ideology of conducting original research,making technology breakthrough, and getting achievements to promote industry.The laboratory aims to form its own characteristic and superiority in scientific research and application development of novel software technologies, as well as in the cultivation of high-quality talents, and contributesin promotingeffective and rapid development of China's software industry.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwweywwaboratory/list.htm	Till the end of 2013, the lab has undertaken over 560 research projects,including the national 973 projects, 863 projects, national S&T major projects, national science fund for distinguished young scholars, the national natural science funds, provincial ministries, international cooperation and horizontal collaboration project. Moreover, the lab has published over 5000 papers in important international journals including AI、JMLR、JSAC、PR、TKDE、TMM、TOSEM、TPAMI、TPDS、TSE、Science China and important conferences includingAAAI、ACM MM、CAV、COLT、CVPR、FMCAD、ICDCS、ICML、ICNP、ICSE、ICWS、IJCAI、INFOCOM、ISSTA、KDD、MOBIHOC、NIPS、OOPSLA、SPAA、UBICOMP、WWW,etc. The lab has also published 47 academic books. These high-quality papers have been cited by peer researchers fromUSA, UK, Germany, France, Russia, Japan, etc. Due to its establishment, the laboratory has won 79 prizes at the national or ministerial levels, including one second-class National Prize of Natural Science, four second-class National Prizesof Scientific and Technological Progress, two ministerial-level Grand Prizes, 10ministerial-level First Prizes, 24 ministerial-level Second Prizes, two academic books won the First Prizes of Excellent Textbook from Ministry of Education, respectively. The laboratory has won three National Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations, six CCF Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations, and four Jiangsu Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations. The laboratory has also made great efforts on developing real-life applications, and played an important role in economic and social developments of China. It has been granted 130 patents and 61 software copyrights till the end of 2013.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwweywwaboratory/list.htm	Many of the researchers of the lab have served as committee members in important academic programs and organizations, including the information science domain expert committee of the National Grand Fundamental Research Program (973) and the National High-Tech Research and Development Program (863); general expert committee of the National S&T Major Program; information science domain advisory expert committee and expert committee of the Major Research Plan of the National Natural Science Foundation of China; disciplinary assessment team of the Academic Degree Committee of the State Council; China Computer Federation and its technical committees; Chinese Association forArtificial Intelligence and its technical committees; United Nations University; International Institute for Software Technology (UNU/IIST); ACM China Council; IEEE Nanjing Section; and IEEE Computer Society (Nanjing Chapter). The researchers have also served as advisers, executiveeditors, associate chief editors, associate editors, domain editors and editors for Chinese and international academic journals and transactions. They have also served in many academic conferences as steering committee chairs and members, general (co-) chairs, program committee (co-) chairs and area chairs. In 2005, the research team on “Software Methodology and Technology for Internet” won the title of Innovative Research Teamof the Ministry of Educationof China. In 2007, the team won the Science Fund for Creative Research Groups of the National Natural Science Foundation of China. It continued to receive the rolling fund in 2011 and 2014.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwwollaborativewwnnovationwwenterswforwwrojectw2011/list.htm	The Collaborative Innovation Center of Advanced Microstructures (CICAM), a close alliance made up of the national laboratories and centers from Nanjing Univ., Fudan Univ., Shanghai Jiao Tong Univ., Zhejiang Univ., Univ. of Science and Technology of China, and the Hefei Institutes of Physical Science, plus the Huawei Technologies, an advanced industry symbol of China, was formally authenticated by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Finance of China in 2014 under the 2011 Plan Initiatives. This alliance, led by Nanjing Univ.,is committed to undertaking advanced R&D activities in broad areas of Science and Technology of Microstructures at the crossover of condensed matter physics, materials sciences, information sciences, and energy technologies, focusing on cutting-edge and emergentsciences and technologies of artificial bandgap matters, correlated electron systems, and small quantum systems, among others in the inter-disciplines, while substantial efforts will be devoted to transfer of research findings into relevant applications.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwwollaborativewwnnovationwwenterswforwwrojectw2011/list.htm	Under the comprehensive supports of the national administrations and R&D funding agencies, the major strategies developed in the CICAM include recruiting high-level and aggressive younger talents, establishing and promoting advanced research infrastructures and capabilities, and spinning-off innovative technologies for next-generations of quantum devices and integrated systems. One of the CICAM’s missions is to establish itself as a leading institution of international reputations in the field of advanced microstructures where research findings and inventions catalyze Chinese industry and meet their core technology needs. The center is also committed to training researchers and drawing prominent scientists from across the country to feed Chinese dreams that rejuvenate the country through science and technology.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwwocalwwointwwngineeringwwesearchwwenter/list.htm	National & Local Joint Engineering Research Center of Energy-efficient Semiconductor Devices and Materials
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwwocalwwointwwngineeringwwesearchwwenter/list.htm	The National & Local Joint Engineering Research Center of Energy-efficient Semiconductor Devices and Materials was founded in November 2012 under the support of the National Development and Reform Commission and the support from Nanjing University. It collaborates with top universities, research institutes and major industrial partners throughout the country. To fasten the development of semiconductor energy-saving industries of Jiangsu province, the research center focuses on developing core technologies of solid state lighting and energy-saving electronics. It strives to supply all-round, professional, and multi-level public R&D services and to promote technology transfer. Based on advanced semiconductor materials and device concepts, the center aims to improve the efficiency of electro-optical conversion, photo-electric conversion and electro-electric conversion as well as to develop more efficient power management methods. Its main task is to provide sustainable intellectual and technical support for the technology advancement of solid state lighting industry in Jiangsu Province, and also for the innovation of energy-efficient semiconductor technologies.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wationalwwocalwwointwwngineeringwwesearchwwenter/list.htm	The center covers an area of 3000 m2, including a 1000 m2cleanroom. The facilities include metal-organic chemical vapor deposition, hydride vapor phase epitaxy and other material growth systems, material and device characterization systems, and device fabrication equipment. The center is also supported by the infrastructures of Nanjing University as well as industrial companies of Jiangsu Province. Its on-going projects are targeted to promote the whole technical level of solid state lighting and electronic industries of Jiangsu Province. It has realized innovation service functions of technical support, standard making, information sharing, and technology transfer during the past three years, and now becomes one of the top R&D service platforms in China. The overall objective of the center is to foster a prospective incubator base for solid state lighting and energy-saving semiconductor industries in Jiangsu Province, which would benefit the whole industry chain.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorieswofwthewwinistrywofwwducation/list.htm	River-sea interaction and coastal & shelf development and application
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorieswofwthewwinistrywofwwducation/list.htm	Coastal towns & tourism planning and management

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorieswofwthewwinistrywofwwducation/list.htm	Welcome scholars who are committed to earth sciences, especially coast & ocean researches, to join us.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wngineeringwwesearchwwenterswofwthewwinistrywofwwducation/list.htm	The Engineering Research Center of Therapeutic Proteins and Peptides was formed at the beginning of 2004, and formally supported by the Ministry of Education in 2006, and finally certified by the Ministry of Education at the end of 2008. The research team of the center is led by senior scientists who had worked for many years in the most prestigious universities and pharmaceutical companies in United States. The center has 8,000 square meters of R&D labs for biopharmaceutical technology, 6,000 square meters of a GMP pilot production platform for recombinant proteins and peptides, and 1,000 square meters of a SPF animal facility for preclinical studies.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wngineeringwwesearchwwenterswofwthewwinistrywofwwducation/list.htm	5 winners of National Technology Invention Awards (second class) and National Science & Technology Progress Awards (second class);
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	The Jiangsu Provincial Laboratory of Photonic and Electronic Materials Sciences and Technology (PEMST) was founded in August 2003, mainly based on the microelectronics and solid-state electronics discipline of Nanjing University (national key discipline), and merging a national key discipline, theoretical physics and two doctor degree awarding disciplines, optics and optoelectronics and organic chemistry. Associative institute of PEMST includes the Metallic Organic-compound (MO) source R&D Center of Nanjing University and the opto-electronic and Network Engineering Research Center of Nanjing University. And the PEMST has close collaborations with other research institutes, such as the National Laboratory of Solid-State Microstructures of Nanjing University, the Contemporary Materials Research Center, Institute of Solid-State Physics, Institute of Applied Physics, Research Center of Opto-electronics and Institute of Microelectronics.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	The laboratory has taken charge of / taken part in three projects from the national “973 program”, 8 projects from the national “863 program”, 2 projects from national natural science foundation of China's major scientific equipment development, over 10 projects from the general program, and other projects. More than 200 academic papers have been published, including over 60 SCI papers. The lab has applied for over 50 patents, among which more than 10 were authorized. The lab takes part in making one national standards and designs 3 new products. The lab has obtained 2 Second Class Prizes of the State Scientific and Technological Progress Award, and 1 Third Class Prize of the Jiangsu Scientific and Technological Award.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	Oriented to the cutting-edge development of international science and technology, the laboratory has engaged in research on carbon cycling and remote land and atmospheric sensing. It has received support by China’s national “973 Program,” the National key R&D Programs, and the National Natural Science Fund. It focuses on current important issues in the global carbon cycle research and has carried out research in remote sensing and surveillance, modeling and simulating, and atmospheric inversion. It tries to optimize the computation of land carbon sources in different regions, illustrate carbon storage and flux under varied terrestrial ecosystems in different regions of the world, and define China’s contributions to the global ecosystem carbon sink. Such research has yielded over 20 SCI / SSCI papers on such internationally famous academic journals as PNAS and RSE.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	In 2014, the laboratory completed its national key scientific research project, “the Evolution Driving Mechanism and Optimized Computing Research of Carbon Sources & Sinks of Terrestrial Ecosystem in Different Regions of the World” and was rated “excellent” in the acceptance check carried out by the State Ministry of Science and Technology.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	In 2016, the laboratory was entrusted to lead the national key R&D project, “High Resolution Systematic Research of Global Carbon Assimilation Based on Multi-Source Satellite Remote Sensing.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	It won the second prize of the National Science and Technology Progress Award of Year 2014 and the first prize of the Ministry-of-Education Science and Technology Progress Award of Year 2013 for the research result of its project “the Remote Sensing & Comprehensive Monitoring of the South China Sea and its Surroundings, and Analysis of Decision-Making & Supporting.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/weywwaboratorywofwwiangsu/list.htm	In 2013, the laboratory participated in the appraisal of the “Collaborative Innovation Center of the South China Sea,” one of the first National 2011 Programs of China, and collaboratively constructed the platform of “Remote Sensing & Monitoring and Situation Analysis of the South China Sea.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wiangsuwwollaborativewwnnovationwwenter/list.htm	The Center has obtained 142 national key R & D projects and other research projects, received new research funding of 495.4 million CNY, participated in 18 standard-settings, published 336 high level research papers, applied/granted more than 400 patents and obtained 21 national and provincial awards.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wiangsuwwollaborativewwnnovationwwenter/list.htm	According to its development plan during the period of 2013-2016, the Collaborative Innovation Center focuses on laws, mechanism and predictability of interdecadal variation of the Asian monsoon climate. The key scientific problem to be solved is relative contribution of the climate system's natural variability and regional human activities to climate change in China and the East Asia in 10-30 years.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroduction/list.htm	The faculty in the institute consists of 12 staff researchers, including 5 Professors, 4 Associate Professors and 3 Lecturers. The institute receives funding from the Chinese Government and attracts funding through R&D projects from many other leading corporations, such as the National Key Fundamental Research Program (the 973 program), National Nature Science Foundation, Jiangsu Research Program Grant, and Research Project of State Grid. In the past 5 years, the institute members published more than 60 research papers on journals like IEEE Transactions on Parallel and Distributed Systems, IEEE Transactions on Computer, IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology, Computer Communications, and international conferences such as ICNP, INFOCOM, MobiHoc, ICDCS, IPDPS, IWQoS, ICPP etc. The institute has applied for 18 national patents (10 patents granted) and registered 10 software copyrights. The institute has also actively launched cooperation and co-cultivation project with Nanjing University Jinling College and Yancheng Teachers University.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroduction/list.htm	The institute aims at promoting the software industry of Jiangsu and conduct cutting-edge research in the field of software engineering. It focuses on the new technology of computer software, such as new-style programing methodology, software quality assurance, distributed & parallel computing, system software & information security and multimedia technology. The institute pays attention to software testing platform, Internet of things, cloud computing platform, interactive video service and biomedical engineering and has made a contribution to the Chines software industry.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroduction/list.htm	The center has won 8 provincial and ministerial level awards, including 1 first prize of natural science of the National Science & Technology Award nominated by the Ministry of Education and 1 first prize of Jiangsu Provincial Science and Technology Progress Award.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroduction/list.htm	Following the principle of “Planning with high aims, constructing by high standards, and making progress at a high speed,” the center is striving to come up with solutions to common requirements and typical applications in testing and validation of IOT research, to develop management and operation mechanisms of openness, sharing, competition and efficiency, and to improve teaching and scientific research condition and facilities of the experiment platform. Based on the construction of the experimental platform, the center strives to improve its technological innovation on IOT testing and verification and solve important S&T problems concerning the application of IOT, improve its competitive strength to undertake national significant scientific and technical duties and carry out high-level international cooperation, improve disciplinary optimizing and crossing, make significant scientific and technological achievements in IOT testing and verification and play an important role in the development of the national innovation system.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	“Jiangsu Economic Internationalization Research Center” was founded in 2011 in Nanjing University. The center is expected to integrate the social science researchers in Jiangsu province and even in China, as well as practitioners who have a lot of relevant working experiences, to study the strategic policy of Jiangsu for the effective development of itsopeneconomy. The center focuses on theforward-lookingthoughts and operational policy recommendations, in order to expand the opening-up and stimulate the transformation of Jiangsu's economy.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	Thirteen decision-making consulting projects have been undertaken and completed by 2016 including one major project and four key projects. Four consulting reports were accepted by Decision-making Consultation, social sciences circles'union of Jiangsu Province. Two decision-making reports have been approved by provincialParty committeesecretary. Two have been approved by provincial vice-governor. There are also three published by Research Report, Government Research Office of Jiangsu Province. Report named Industrial Selection for 'GoingGlobal' Enterprises of Jiangsu Province was adopted by Jiangsu Department of Commerce as an important reference for the formulation of catalogue of Industries for guiding enterprises' “going-out”. Most of the research results were published in newspapers and journals.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	Since its establishment, the center has built its research forces with concentrations on thoughts of modern Chinese literature, native literature in 20thcentury China, schools of modern Chinese literature, history of modern Chinese drama, literature in Chinese in Taiwan, Hong Kong and foreign countries, and Enlightenment thinking and 20thcentury Chinese literature. The center aims to become an authority in research on new Chinese literature. It has organized academic events andactivities such as hosting national and international conferences, putting out the academic journal Modern Chinese Literature Research, and compiling books Jiming Series (Books 1 & 11) and New Chinese Literature Studies Series.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	As a national key research base, the center’s goal is to establish a mechanism of research innovation, reach the advanced level in the domestic industry, make first-class scientific research achievements and become a national research base that is worthy of its name. Besides, it aims to becoming a national academic exchange and information base for economics by means of holding wide-ranging and high-level academic activities. What's more, facing governments at all levels and the community of all sectors, it plans to create its own brands and finally become a nationally famous think tank and consultation service institution through a wide range of vertical and horizontal research activities.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	Center for Risk, Disaster & Crisis Research (CRDCR), Nanjing University, established in 2005, is the leading center in research on the management of risks, disasters and crises in China.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	In 2014, CRDCR, with the support of the Tang's Foundation in the USA, started to initiate a project in developing a multi-disciplinary network of risk, disaster, and crisis research in China, which includes tasks of case collection, research community building, and laboratory simulation.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	Public Opinion Analysis and Policy Support Research Base of Jiangsu Province is established at the School of Journalism & Communication, Nanjing University. As aninterdisciplinaryand interdepartmentalpublic opinion study center, the research base provides a place of resource sharing and research exchange for related institutions and departments.By taking full advantage of the academic resources, it focuses on cutting-edge issues, prospective investigations, global situations and strategic problems related to social public opinion analysis, public opinion monitoring, and social governance innovation. It aims at developing itself into a comprehensive,multidisciplinaryand high-level academic institution specializing in providing strategicsupportfor relevant government departments and institutions.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	Public Affairs & LocalGovernanceResearchCenter
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	The Public Affairs & Local Governance Research Center of Nanjing University was founded in 1997 and was one of the first group of research institutions nominated as the Key Philosophy and Social Science Research Centers of Jiangsu Province.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	center's website
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	The grassroots organization is an integral part of the governing system in China. The building of local party cells and community-level governments is one of the key factors in the modernization of the governing ability. Founded in 2011 and managed by the School of Government, Nanjing University, the Grassroots Organization Building Research Base of Jiangsu Province is a joint project of Nanjing University, the organization department of Jiangsu provincial CPC committee, and Macro-Economic Research Institute of the State Development and Reform Commission of the People's Republic of China. Manned by full-time and part-time scholars of different age groups and academic backgrounds, the base has 15 researchers (4 of them are professors, and 5 are associate professors), Professor Zhu Guoyun being the chief expert.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	The institute focuses on the process of China's modernization. Its mission is to promote research on industrial policy and competition policy, providing the government with suggestions for scientific and democratic decision-making. As a high-end think tank, it aims to build bridges between advisory suggestions and innovative ideas to guide public opinions, business services, and foreign communications. It takes on a new think tank style and presents a new image. Service, guidance and innovation is its motto which leads it to new scientific, standardized and systematic think tank construction with Chinese characteristics.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/wntroductions/list.htm	The center has signed a strategic agreement of cooperation with the Center for Think Tank Studies & Release of Guangming Daily and established a cooperation mechanism to carry out think tank research and evaluation. The two sides not only cooperate in data and evaluation of CTTI, but have also launched the compilation project of Guidance for Managing Chinese Think Tank, for which they held the “Forum for Chinese Think Tank Governance.” Besides, the center publishes Think Tank: Theory & Practice in cooperation with the National Science Library of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and this is the first Chinese peer-review journal focusing on think tank research.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/80/51/c7136a163921/page.htm	Our Department offers a B.A. program in philosophy and M.A. and Ph.D. programs in eight divisions of philosophy: Marxism, Chinese Philosophy, Foreign Philosophy, Logic, Ethics, Philosophy of Science & Technology, Religious Studies, Eastern Philosophy and Religion. The Marxism program at NJU is widely regarded as one of the best ones in China. It has been one of the National Key Programs recognized by the Ministry of Education of China.

location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/e0/c7673a169696/page.htm	As one of the major research centers in the field of condensed matter physics in China, NLSSM carried out researches projects on various sub-fields: artificial microstructure physics, quantum physics and the associated electronics, nanostructure properties and devices, soft condensed matter physics and computational physics. These research efforts are funded by several national, provincial and ministerial research funds, including 6 projects by the National Basic Research Program of China (973 Program), 15 sub-projects of the 973 Program, 4 projects of the National High-Tech R&D Program of China, 7 projects of the Key Program of National Natural Science Fund of China and so on. Since 2002, NLSSM’s faculty members have won the first prize of the NationalNatural Science once and the second prize of the NationalNatural Science 6 times.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/dd/c7673a169693/page.htm	The laboratory mainly focuses onthe researchof novel software technologies and the correspondingapplications. It aims to leverage the challenges and opportunities in the rapid development of novel software technologies, and meets the requirements in the aspect of information construction of the country. Moreover, the laboratory explores important scientific problems in the area of computer software, studies basic and common problems in novel software technologies, and adheres to the guiding ideology of conducting original research,making technology breakthrough, and getting achievements to promote industry.The laboratory aims to form its own characteristic and superiority in scientific research and application development of novel software technologies, as well as in the cultivation of high-quality talents, and contributesin promotingeffective and rapid development of China's software industry.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/dd/c7673a169693/page.htm	Till the end of 2013, the lab has undertaken over 560 research projects,including the national 973 projects, 863 projects, national S&T major projects, national science fund for distinguished young scholars, the national natural science funds, provincial ministries, international cooperation and horizontal collaboration project. Moreover, the lab has published over 5000 papers in important international journals including AI、JMLR、JSAC、PR、TKDE、TMM、TOSEM、TPAMI、TPDS、TSE、Science China and important conferences includingAAAI、ACM MM、CAV、COLT、CVPR、FMCAD、ICDCS、ICML、ICNP、ICSE、ICWS、IJCAI、INFOCOM、ISSTA、KDD、MOBIHOC、NIPS、OOPSLA、SPAA、UBICOMP、WWW,etc. The lab has also published 47 academic books. These high-quality papers have been cited by peer researchers fromUSA, UK, Germany, France, Russia, Japan, etc. Due to its establishment, the laboratory has won 79 prizes at the national or ministerial levels, including one second-class National Prize of Natural Science, four second-class National Prizesof Scientific and Technological Progress, two ministerial-level Grand Prizes, 10ministerial-level First Prizes, 24 ministerial-level Second Prizes, two academic books won the First Prizes of Excellent Textbook from Ministry of Education, respectively. The laboratory has won three National Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations, six CCF Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations, and four Jiangsu Outstanding Doctoral Dissertations. The laboratory has also made great efforts on developing real-life applications, and played an important role in economic and social developments of China. It has been granted 130 patents and 61 software copyrights till the end of 2013.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/dd/c7673a169693/page.htm	Many of the researchers of the lab have served as committee members in important academic programs and organizations, including the information science domain expert committee of the National Grand Fundamental Research Program (973) and the National High-Tech Research and Development Program (863); general expert committee of the National S&T Major Program; information science domain advisory expert committee and expert committee of the Major Research Plan of the National Natural Science Foundation of China; disciplinary assessment team of the Academic Degree Committee of the State Council; China Computer Federation and its technical committees; Chinese Association forArtificial Intelligence and its technical committees; United Nations University; International Institute for Software Technology (UNU/IIST); ACM China Council; IEEE Nanjing Section; and IEEE Computer Society (Nanjing Chapter). The researchers have also served as advisers, executiveeditors, associate chief editors, associate editors, domain editors and editors for Chinese and international academic journals and transactions. They have also served in many academic conferences as steering committee chairs and members, general (co-) chairs, program committee (co-) chairs and area chairs. In 2005, the research team on “Software Methodology and Technology for Internet” won the title of Innovative Research Teamof the Ministry of Educationof China. In 2007, the team won the Science Fund for Creative Research Groups of the National Natural Science Foundation of China. It continued to receive the rolling fund in 2011 and 2014.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/e4/c7674a169700/page.htm	The Collaborative Innovation Center of Advanced Microstructures (CICAM), a close alliance made up of the national laboratories and centers from Nanjing Univ., Fudan Univ., Shanghai Jiao Tong Univ., Zhejiang Univ., Univ. of Science and Technology of China, and the Hefei Institutes of Physical Science, plus the Huawei Technologies, an advanced industry symbol of China, was formally authenticated by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Finance of China in 2014 under the 2011 Plan Initiatives. This alliance, led by Nanjing Univ.,is committed to undertaking advanced R&D activities in broad areas of Science and Technology of Microstructures at the crossover of condensed matter physics, materials sciences, information sciences, and energy technologies, focusing on cutting-edge and emergentsciences and technologies of artificial bandgap matters, correlated electron systems, and small quantum systems, among others in the inter-disciplines, while substantial efforts will be devoted to transfer of research findings into relevant applications.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/e4/c7674a169700/page.htm	Under the comprehensive supports of the national administrations and R&D funding agencies, the major strategies developed in the CICAM include recruiting high-level and aggressive younger talents, establishing and promoting advanced research infrastructures and capabilities, and spinning-off innovative technologies for next-generations of quantum devices and integrated systems. One of the CICAM’s missions is to establish itself as a leading institution of international reputations in the field of advanced microstructures where research findings and inventions catalyze Chinese industry and meet their core technology needs. The center is also committed to training researchers and drawing prominent scientists from across the country to feed Chinese dreams that rejuvenate the country through science and technology.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/ed/c7669a169709/page.htm	River-sea interaction and coastal & shelf development and application
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/ed/c7669a169709/page.htm	Coastal towns & tourism planning and management
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/ed/c7669a169709/page.htm	210Pb & 137Cs Radioisotope Dating Laboratory
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/ed/c7669a169709/page.htm	Welcome scholars who are committed to earth sciences, especially coast & ocean researches, to join us.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f1/c7668a169713/page.htm	The Engineering Research Center of Therapeutic Proteins and Peptides was formed at the beginning of 2004, and formally supported by the Ministry of Education in 2006, and finally certified by the Ministry of Education at the end of 2008. The research team of the center is led by senior scientists who had worked for many years in the most prestigious universities and pharmaceutical companies in United States. The center has 8,000 square meters of R&D labs for biopharmaceutical technology, 6,000 square meters of a GMP pilot production platform for recombinant proteins and peptides, and 1,000 square meters of a SPF animal facility for preclinical studies.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f0/c7668a169712/page.htm	5 winners of National Technology Invention Awards (second class) and National Science & Technology Progress Awards (second class);
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/fa/c7666a169722/page.htm	The Jiangsu Provincial Laboratory of Photonic and Electronic Materials Sciences and Technology (PEMST) was founded in August 2003, mainly based on the microelectronics and solid-state electronics discipline of Nanjing University (national key discipline), and merging a national key discipline, theoretical physics and two doctor degree awarding disciplines, optics and optoelectronics and organic chemistry. Associative institute of PEMST includes the Metallic Organic-compound (MO) source R&D Center of Nanjing University and the opto-electronic and Network Engineering Research Center of Nanjing University. And the PEMST has close collaborations with other research institutes, such as the National Laboratory of Solid-State Microstructures of Nanjing University, the Contemporary Materials Research Center, Institute of Solid-State Physics, Institute of Applied Physics, Research Center of Opto-electronics and Institute of Microelectronics.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f8/c7666a169720/page.htm	The laboratory has taken charge of / taken part in three projects from the national “973 program”, 8 projects from the national “863 program”, 2 projects from national natural science foundation of China's major scientific equipment development, over 10 projects from the general program, and other projects. More than 200 academic papers have been published, including over 60 SCI papers. The lab has applied for over 50 patents, among which more than 10 were authorized. The lab takes part in making one national standards and designs 3 new products. The lab has obtained 2 Second Class Prizes of the State Scientific and Technological Progress Award, and 1 Third Class Prize of the Jiangsu Scientific and Technological Award.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f5/c7666a169717/page.htm	Oriented to the cutting-edge development of international science and technology, the laboratory has engaged in research on carbon cycling and remote land and atmospheric sensing. It has received support by China’s national “973 Program,” the National key R&D Programs, and the National Natural Science Fund. It focuses on current important issues in the global carbon cycle research and has carried out research in remote sensing and surveillance, modeling and simulating, and atmospheric inversion. It tries to optimize the computation of land carbon sources in different regions, illustrate carbon storage and flux under varied terrestrial ecosystems in different regions of the world, and define China’s contributions to the global ecosystem carbon sink. Such research has yielded over 20 SCI / SSCI papers on such internationally famous academic journals as PNAS and RSE.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f5/c7666a169717/page.htm	In 2014, the laboratory completed its national key scientific research project, “the Evolution Driving Mechanism and Optimized Computing Research of Carbon Sources & Sinks of Terrestrial Ecosystem in Different Regions of the World” and was rated “excellent” in the acceptance check carried out by the State Ministry of Science and Technology.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f5/c7666a169717/page.htm	In 2016, the laboratory was entrusted to lead the national key R&D project, “High Resolution Systematic Research of Global Carbon Assimilation Based on Multi-Source Satellite Remote Sensing.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f5/c7666a169717/page.htm	It won the second prize of the National Science and Technology Progress Award of Year 2014 and the first prize of the Ministry-of-Education Science and Technology Progress Award of Year 2013 for the research result of its project “the Remote Sensing & Comprehensive Monitoring of the South China Sea and its Surroundings, and Analysis of Decision-Making & Supporting.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/f5/c7666a169717/page.htm	In 2013, the laboratory participated in the appraisal of the “Collaborative Innovation Center of the South China Sea,” one of the first National 2011 Programs of China, and collaboratively constructed the platform of “Remote Sensing & Monitoring and Situation Analysis of the South China Sea.”
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/98/9d/c7892a170141/page.htm	The Center has obtained 142 national key R & D projects and other research projects, received new research funding of 495.4 million CNY, participated in 18 standard-settings, published 336 high level research papers, applied/granted more than 400 patents and obtained 21 national and provincial awards.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/98/9c/c7892a170140/page.htm	According to its development plan during the period of 2013-2016, the Collaborative Innovation Center focuses on laws, mechanism and predictability of interdecadal variation of the Asian monsoon climate. The key scientific problem to be solved is relative contribution of the climate system's natural variability and regional human activities to climate change in China and the East Asia in 10-30 years.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/cf/c7665a169679/page.htm	The center has won 8 provincial and ministerial level awards, including 1 first prize of natural science of the National Science & Technology Award nominated by the Ministry of Education and 1 first prize of Jiangsu Provincial Science and Technology Progress Award.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/96/ce/c7665a169678/page.htm	Following the principle of “Planning with high aims, constructing by high standards, and making progress at a high speed,” the center is striving to come up with solutions to common requirements and typical applications in testing and validation of IOT research, to develop management and operation mechanisms of openness, sharing, competition and efficiency, and to improve teaching and scientific research condition and facilities of the experiment platform. Based on the construction of the experimental platform, the center strives to improve its technological innovation on IOT testing and verification and solve important S&T problems concerning the application of IOT, improve its competitive strength to undertake national significant scientific and technical duties and carry out high-level international cooperation, improve disciplinary optimizing and crossing, make significant scientific and technological achievements in IOT testing and verification and play an important role in the development of the national innovation system.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/95/dc/c7549a169436/page.htm	“Jiangsu Economic Internationalization Research Center” was founded in 2011 in Nanjing University. The center is expected to integrate the social science researchers in Jiangsu province and even in China, as well as practitioners who have a lot of relevant working experiences, to study the strategic policy of Jiangsu for the effective development of itsopeneconomy. The center focuses on theforward-lookingthoughts and operational policy recommendations, in order to expand the opening-up and stimulate the transformation of Jiangsu's economy.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/95/dc/c7549a169436/page.htm	Thirteen decision-making consulting projects have been undertaken and completed by 2016 including one major project and four key projects. Four consulting reports were accepted by Decision-making Consultation, social sciences circles'union of Jiangsu Province. Two decision-making reports have been approved by provincialParty committeesecretary. Two have been approved by provincial vice-governor. There are also three published by Research Report, Government Research Office of Jiangsu Province. Report named Industrial Selection for 'GoingGlobal' Enterprises of Jiangsu Province was adopted by Jiangsu Department of Commerce as an important reference for the formulation of catalogue of Industries for guiding enterprises' “going-out”. Most of the research results were published in newspapers and journals.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/49/c7549a166985/page.htm	Since its establishment, the center has built its research forces with concentrations on thoughts of modern Chinese literature, native literature in 20thcentury China, schools of modern Chinese literature, history of modern Chinese drama, literature in Chinese in Taiwan, Hong Kong and foreign countries, and Enlightenment thinking and 20thcentury Chinese literature. The center aims to become an authority in research on new Chinese literature. It has organized academic events andactivities such as hosting national and international conferences, putting out the academic journal Modern Chinese Literature Research, and compiling books Jiming Series (Books 1 & 11) and New Chinese Literature Studies Series.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/47/c7549a166983/page.htm	As a national key research base, the center’s goal is to establish a mechanism of research innovation, reach the advanced level in the domestic industry, make first-class scientific research achievements and become a national research base that is worthy of its name. Besides, it aims to becoming a national academic exchange and information base for economics by means of holding wide-ranging and high-level academic activities. What's more, facing governments at all levels and the community of all sectors, it plans to create its own brands and finally become a nationally famous think tank and consultation service institution through a wide range of vertical and horizontal research activities.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/43/c7549a166979/page.htm	Center for Risk, Disaster & Crisis Research (CRDCR), Nanjing University, established in 2005, is the leading center in research on the management of risks, disasters and crises in China.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/43/c7549a166979/page.htm	In 2014, CRDCR, with the support of the Tang's Foundation in the USA, started to initiate a project in developing a multi-disciplinary network of risk, disaster, and crisis research in China, which includes tasks of case collection, research community building, and laboratory simulation.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/41/c7549a166977/page.htm	Public Opinion Analysis and Policy Support Research Base of Jiangsu Province is established at the School of Journalism & Communication, Nanjing University. As aninterdisciplinaryand interdepartmentalpublic opinion study center, the research base provides a place of resource sharing and research exchange for related institutions and departments.By taking full advantage of the academic resources, it focuses on cutting-edge issues, prospective investigations, global situations and strategic problems related to social public opinion analysis, public opinion monitoring, and social governance innovation. It aims at developing itself into a comprehensive,multidisciplinaryand high-level academic institution specializing in providing strategicsupportfor relevant government departments and institutions.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/3f/c7549a166975/page.htm	Public Affairs & LocalGovernanceResearchCenter
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/3f/c7549a166975/page.htm	The Public Affairs & Local Governance Research Center of Nanjing University was founded in 1997 and was one of the first group of research institutions nominated as the Key Philosophy and Social Science Research Centers of Jiangsu Province.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/3f/c7549a166975/page.htm	center's website
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/34/c7549a166964/page.htm	The grassroots organization is an integral part of the governing system in China. The building of local party cells and community-level governments is one of the key factors in the modernization of the governing ability. Founded in 2011 and managed by the School of Government, Nanjing University, the Grassroots Organization Building Research Base of Jiangsu Province is a joint project of Nanjing University, the organization department of Jiangsu provincial CPC committee, and Macro-Economic Research Institute of the State Development and Reform Commission of the People's Republic of China. Manned by full-time and part-time scholars of different age groups and academic backgrounds, the base has 15 researchers (4 of them are professors, and 5 are associate professors), Professor Zhu Guoyun being the chief expert.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/30/c7549a166960/page.htm	The institute focuses on the process of China's modernization. Its mission is to promote research on industrial policy and competition policy, providing the government with suggestions for scientific and democratic decision-making. As a high-end think tank, it aims to build bridges between advisory suggestions and innovative ideas to guide public opinions, business services, and foreign communications. It takes on a new think tank style and presents a new image. Service, guidance and innovation is its motto which leads it to new scientific, standardized and systematic think tank construction with Chinese characteristics.
location4:not found index:http://www.nju.edu.cn/en/8c/2e/c7549a166958/page.htm	The center has signed a strategic agreement of cooperation with the Center for Think Tank Studies & Release of Guangming Daily and established a cooperation mechanism to carry out think tank research and evaluation. The two sides not only cooperate in data and evaluation of CTTI, but have also launched the compilation project of Guidance for Managing Chinese Think Tank, for which they held the “Forum for Chinese Think Tank Governance.” Besides, the center publishes Think Tank: Theory & Practice in cooperation with the National Science Library of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, and this is the first Chinese peer-review journal focusing on think tank research.

location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/56/89/c1541a22153/page.htm	进一步加强高等学校学生资助工作机构建设，是推进和落实以国家助学贷款为主体的资助高校贫困家庭学生政策和措施的基础性工作。截至目前，部分高校已按要求成立了专门的学生资助管理中心，配备了专职工作人员。但是，多数高校的资助工作机构没有建立起来，专职工作人员配备不足，不能适应新形势下以国家助学贷款为主体的高校资助贫困家庭学生工作的需要。为进一步做好资助高校贫困家庭学生工作，根据《国务院办公厅转发教育部财政部中国人民银行银监会<关于进一步完善国家助学贷款工作的若干意见>的通知》（国办发〔2004〕51号）的规定和国务院有关国家助学贷款工作会议的要求，现就进一步加强高校学生资助工作机构建设的有关问题通知如下：

location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/50/dd/c1521a20701/page.htm	人物：詹尼弗•希普利，1997年—1999年担任新西兰总理，2002年7月退休，结束了富有成就的政治生涯，目前担任詹尼弗•希普利公司、剑桥集团、新西兰国际教育公司等五家公司负责人。 　　“不同行业的人在一起喝咖啡吧，也许能聊出类似‘人类基因’的新东西；要学会忘记知识，只有忘记，才能为新的知识腾位置，才能让你想新问题……”2月26日，新西兰前总理詹尼弗•希普利女士应邀赴南京大学演讲，并就“创新”话题与南大学生精彩互动。
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/50/dd/c1521a20701/page.htm	詹尼弗•希普利女士说，家庭教育对我的成长很重要，我家姐妹三个，父母从来不会限制我们，这是男孩子做的，这是女孩子做的！这是不可以，那是可以的。他们的观点是，世界上没有什么是不可以的。这样的思想在我的头脑里根深蒂固。所以经常有人会问我，为什么一个女性能当总理？我就会很诧异：Whynot？（为什么不）。没有限制，自由成长，即便有什么失败，也会自我解决，即便有什么貌似的禁区，也有办法突破。感谢我父母，这样的创新因子让我常常保有梦想。
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/50/dd/c1521a20701/page.htm	詹尼弗•希普利女士十几年来一直积极推进新西兰经济的改革进程，她领导了社会福利、国家养老金计划和大众健康制度的改革，参与了缩减政府部门规模，引入透明办公机制的工作，还负责了一系列国有企业私有化、意外事故赔偿制度，为奥克兰机场及一些能源公司筹款等事务。 　　这些改革举措，原先看起来都是不可能的事情。詹尼弗•希普利女士说，但是，脑子里的奇思妙想，哪怕是很模糊的，也不要放过任何一个。关键是要写下来，要调研论证，很多事情都是从不可能到可能的，社会也就是这样进步的。
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/50/dd/c1521a20701/page.htm	新西兰有很多亚洲留学生，他们很认真，记笔记、做实验的水平相当高，但他们不会和老师“吵架”。其实，要敢于提出不同观点，要学会asking（提问），要经常说Why？（为什么），为什么是这样的？如果不这样会怎样？很多的道理并不是唯一性的，也是需要触类旁通的。詹尼弗•希普利女士说，我很欣赏新西兰一些学校的做法，不同学部的师生经常到咖啡店里喝咖啡，大家在闲聊中了解不同学科的知识信息，在思想碰撞中获得新的灵感。“人类基因”的最初研究想法就是在咖啡店里诞生的，年轻人，养成跨学科聊天的习惯吧，说不定能聊出个了不起的新发现。
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/1521/list59.htm	<<上一页
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/1521/list59.htm	下一页>>

location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/58/63/c1520a22627/page.htm	校友、师生、社会各界接力祝南大生日快乐 “南京大学•微捐赠”平台正式上线
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/58/63/c1520a22627/page.htm	5月20日是母校南京大学113岁的生日，该为她做点什么呢？孙明华这两天一直在想这个问题。就在昨天，他像往常一样打开大学同学的微信群，一条“我爱南大”的信息已经被转疯了。点开来一看，大家正通过微信平台为母校送上生日祝福。随即他像其他同学一样，悄悄地给母校塞了一个113元的“红包”，而这一切瞬间在“南京大学•微捐赠”平台上被完整地记录下来。
location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/58/63/c1520a22627/page.htm	值得一提的是，“微捐赠”平台上线以后，同时也吸引了校内广大师生的热情参与。新闻传播学院研究生韦玲霞在接受采访时说道：“每年校庆的时候，学校都会给在校学生发放加餐券，大家可以凭此卷到学校食堂免费领取一份美味晚餐。从本科到研究生，已经7年了，每年收到餐券的时候都感到满满的关爱。这次，我也为学校送上一份生日祝福，虽然微小，但却代表了我的一份赤子之心。”在“微捐赠”的平台上，许多校领导的名字也记载其中，大家都用统一的数字“113”元来表达对学校的美好祝愿，正如学校薛海林副校长所说，“南京大学•微捐赠”平台一定程度上起到了传播南大捐赠文化、弘扬南大公益精神、架设南大爱心桥梁的作用。

location4:not found index:http://xgc.nju.edu.cn/a7/12/c1521a42770/page.htm	顾臻校友现为美国北卡大学教堂山分校医学院、药学院，北卡州立大学工学院联合生物医学工程系助理教授；2003年毕业于我校化学化工学院化学系，同年保送至高分子科学与工程系学习，2006年获得理学硕士学位；2010在加州大学洛杉矶分校（UCLA）获得工学博士学位，同年获聘于麻省理工学院化工系/Koch癌症复合研究中心、哈佛大学医学院，担任博士后研究员，师从药物传递、生物医学工程奠基人Robert Langer教授。2012年获聘于北卡大学，建立“生物大分子诊疗工程实验室”。其研究方向包括蛋白质递药系统、生物医用高分子材料、纳米制剂、再生医学工程等。顾臻校友长期致力于智能递药体系的创新研发，用于糖尿病及癌症的精准治疗，近年来在《PNAS》、《Nature Communications》、《Nature Nanotechnology》、《JACS》、《Angewandte Chemie》、《Advanced Materials》、《Nano Letters》及《ACS Nano》等刊物发表论文近60篇，申请专利20余项；其研究曾被《Science》、《Nature》及《Science Translational Medicine》等期刊点评，并被《TIME》、《Fox News》、《Washington Post》及《C&EN》等媒体报道；曾获“美国糖尿病学会青年科学家奖”、“美国糖尿病学会Pathway Award”、“Sigma Xi协会青年教授研究奖”及“细胞/分子生物工程创新者奖”等。
